website_summaries.verdict: The combination of the Sun Joe brand and the easy-to-use grass catcher make it an incredible proposition.
pros: A robust, well-engineered machine made by a company with a reputation for quality
cons: Has some difficulty with wet or thick grass

website_summaries.verdict: The best budget electric Sun Joe lawn mower to buy if you have a smaller yard or need something affordable.
pros: Electric motor starts up quickly without the need for a pull cord or ignition key
Small wheel base turns quickly around objects and obstacles in the yard
cons: Small 14-inch cutting head takes longer to cut a typical lawn than larger options

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for women
customer_reviews.text: This little mower is a beast !...one of my best Amazon purchases by far. I bought it to mow my small front yard and dog pen.However my rider broke for the field and I have been mowing that with this little guy for weeks. I don't use the catcher and just make sure to check its not blocked with grass at the grass exit door. It really easy to push and light weight I am in my 50s and can do with one hand.I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: BLACKDOG

customer_reviews.title: and it did a GREAT job for the price paid
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence with this purchase, but we needed a small mower and the price was right at $80. The lowest cutting setting is what I used, and it did a GREAT job for the price paid. I love that the bagging feature, which was absolutely NOT a buying factor on this unit, works GREAT! It's like a vacuum cleaner for the yard. It packs the clippings in very tight. I have a very small yard and this is great for the job. I worry that the first big rock I hit will break the chassis, but it has not broken yet. Great buy and function.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Wow...amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Better than I expected! I've used cheap mowers, expensive mowers, hired landscapers for years, and used this just about right out of the box and was blown away. Super clean cut, great power for dense areas, and ultra light weight. The fact that it's small I realize now is a benefit, can maneuver effortlessly and walk at a great pace, getting the job done in half the time. And at $99 it's a steal. If you can make this work in your yard get it, you can use up to a 100ft extension cord. 14 gauge should be fine but if you aren't certain of your home wiring get the 12 gauge to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan F.

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you, I’ve never mowed a lawn!! Was sooo skeptical but I figured this was more economical than paying $25-30 every two weeks to have my backyard and front yard mowed. Assembling this was pretty easy, about 15 mins, just follow the manual.. then came the mowing, I was so nervous for a 1st timer but I got the work done and I’m never gone let my grass get that tall again. Thanks Sun Joe, this was the most affordable and efficient lawn mower I found!! Update: My Mower is still working great 😁 last pic is my second time mowing about 7 weeks later. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Really great for about 3 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased early so it was available for May mowing here in Michigan. Tiny yard, and it worked great for 4 cuts. Tried to start it yesterday and nothing. I cut on the longest setting and as I said, I have a tiny tiny city lot. It's electric so I'm not sure who to even call to service it or if I should just toss the thing and but gas. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mower for our small townhouse lawn.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic mower for our small townhouse lawn. Plenty of power. It even cut 6" tall thick grass when we waited too long. After the first year the the retaining clips for the front wheels broke so I called and they simply replaced them at no cost. Before you call for service you need to go to their website and register the product. You'll need the serial number, date of purchase, and where you bought it. I registered it 11 months after I bought it so there does not seem to be a time limit. The two year warranty is nice. Customer service seems great.
customer_reviews.author: Erick R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Electric mowers for the win!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with electric corded lawnmowers, and I much prefer them over the gas models. This machine is lightweight, powerful, and easy to clean. The bag is small, so don't use the bag on your first mow of the season. I like the safety shut off, and the machine will shut itself off when the discharge gets clogged, handy with the heavy wet grass of the PNW. Assembly was easy, you won't even need to look at the directions. All in all, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: kimbeshe

customer_reviews.title: Wish it still worked.
customer_reviews.text: Used the mower about ten times on my small yard. Loved it...but now won't start & no electrical juice. Now I have a grumpy landlord and a pretty little non working mower and no $ to fix it just a couple of months later. Bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Mizstellar

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY I used this twice and it stopped working entirely. Just stopped. Sounds like it wants to turn on and then fails. I read all the reviews before buying and didn't head the warning so many of the reviews had articulated. This is a cheap buy that'll get you through may 1-3 months. And that's about it. Seriously just invest in a better mower. The wheels are terribly misaligned as well. But the actually electric component of the mower is incredibly faulty and not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Abrego

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic; replaced wheels multiple times
customer_reviews.text: We own a townhouse with a small yard. This seemed like a good option for our situation. However, this is such a cheaply made product. It's made of flimsy plastic, even the wheels. The front wheels have broken multiple times and needed replacement (at our expense). You have to squeeze the trigger bar the entire time you're mowing, which cramps up your hand and wrist in just a few minutes. The cord comes unplugged too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Testing testing

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Yard? Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought this plug-in mower for its cheap price. The construction is pretty cheap as well, with a plastic shell, and plastic wheels like you'd find on kid's toys. However, it gets the job done! Cons - the blade spin is pretty weak, and will get bulked down if your grass is too tall. Also, the grass catcher bag doesn't hold a lot, requiring frequent emptying. I've only run over the cord once. lol All that being said, I'd still recommend this to folks with very small yards.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't great to start with
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lawn mower for 2 months. It wasn't great to start with. I have to go over the same areas repeatedly to get all the grass. Now 2 months later, it just won't start. Dont waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, quiet mower for small yards
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in January and just assembled it yesterday to use it for the 1st time. At first, I'm like...eh, this isn't going to be great, it felt like a toy, hard plastic, super lightweight. I have a small to mid size yard so I wheeled it back, plugged it in and I was super impressed! It's very light and quiet! But, most importantly it got the job done!! With this being the 1st cut there were some high grass patches where it seemed to "stall" but I mowed in short bursts over those patches. Emptied the grass catcher twice and filled up my grass bucket. I recommend this mower!!
customer_reviews.author: code87

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small lawns.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Works perfectly. Quiet, easy to assemble, obviously easy to use. Soft start doesn't draw a lot of amps, nice feature. Grass catcher catches it all. Thank you for a near perfect machine for my postage stamp of a lawn. If I had a suggestion it's that the handle is a tad too long but that is soooo minor compared to all the positives. I also have your Snow Joe snow thrower. You should make the handle foldable like that unit. Let's see more Joe products!
customer_reviews.author: idontwantto

customer_reviews.title: Great little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: This little Sun Joe mower is a workhorse!! After the crazy rain we had in California recently I had to mow my lawn as it was way over grown with clover and weeds. Full on 2-3 ft high in some spots and it took care of it! I was skeptical at first as it looks like a toy, but great little mower kicked butt! Only con is when you have a lot of grass to cut the grass collector gets filled quickly. Probably should have bought a bigger mower but it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Murtha

customer_reviews.title: Returning this lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I got this mower to use on a small lawn and had a hard time getting it to push through the grass, which wasn't even that tall. I also had a hard time keeping it on after starting it. This is my fourth electric lawnmower and I am returning it. It's almost all plastic and not as good quality as other electric mowers I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica J Smith

customer_reviews.title: poor  customer service
customer_reviews.text: after receiving, I assembled except holes didn't line up, not sure if they were suppose to. the top handle went on as expected, BUT after putting in a comfortable position, it doesn't hold, making it unuseable for me. I contacted CX and received a canned response not addressing my questions with a case #. waited 2 days, no response, went to Amazon site and sent co another email including the case #. AND I received another email with a new case # BUT no help with issues. If I don't receive any help today, I will be forced to return. This mower may work wonderfully, but I may never know
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Good mower, kind of narrow, wish the height adjustment system was more robust.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Quieter than a ICE mower. Would recommend adding the attachment that shunts clippings to the side, unless you like getting sprayed with grass. The wheel spring height system is kind of annoying (it's great in theory but bumps and things can knock the wheel up or down, resulting in an uneven lawn). Pros: No gas, no oil. Doesn't seem to lose power in higher grass. Very light. Cons: Mind the extension cords. Easy to knock a wheel out of alignment. Feels like I'm vacuuming my lawn, not mowing it (-2 to Manliness, +1 to Eco-conscious).
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Kinkaid

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today. I’m a grandma in her middle 60s. I like the grass catcher which is easy to put on and take off and empty. The wheels are adjustable for different cutting heights. It’s easy to maneuver, especially for women and children. If it has a con, then it is that if your grass is too thick and high, it loads it down and the blades stop. So you’ll need to first cut your grass with something else such as a manual or more powerful gas or electric. I used a manual push mower. Once you get your grass height under control, then a weekly pass with this is great. And no raking.
customer_reviews.author: Kar-Bear

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lawnmower for small yards
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying the my yard is 10' x 20' total. This, my demands for mowing are specific. I had originally bought a 12" mower that is a weedwacker with the wheeled base. While it worked fine, the cut was always uneven. During the hot summer this left some areas so short they died. I bought the Sun Joe mower to get an even cut. It does the job and has a bagger too! It cuts well and maneuvers easily. My 81 year old mother, who usually mows the lawn (don't ask, not my idea), loves it. Light, smooth and simple. The perfect small lawn mower!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... do my lawn and also get around tight areas like trees and flower beds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sun Joe mower to quickly do my lawn and also get around tight areas like trees and flower beds. As a petite women, I found it so easy to move around and it did a great job on my lawn. And even though it says it's for smaller lawns, I ended up cutting a large area without any problems. Also what I liked was I was able to assemble it myself very easily. Now I just ordered the Sun Joe dethatcher, so I'm looking forward to how that works!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise F

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yard!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great "yard vacuum" as I like to call it. I feel like I am cleaning the floors when I mow the yard. I have a very small yard, this works great! Consistent cut, perfect width, and pretty easy to maneuver. My fence and the rotary handle knobs clash at times, but otherwise it works great. Heavier than I would expect for something this small, but overall good stuff! All 3 of the mow height settings are relatively close cuts, would like one higher option to clean up the grass but not cut too far for these hot months.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Travel nurse and live in my fifth wheel. I have a dog fence around my little yard for my yorkies so I need to take care if inside if fence. This mower is absolutely amazing and so quiet. I have a bad back and Knee's and was fearful I wouldn't be able to use it but it's so lightweight and easy to empty the bag. I recommend this for everyone! I would definitely buy this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died 3 times
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this mower since I have a very small plot of land. On three different occasions the mower just stopped working on me for several days and would not start again. My grass is not particularly High but for some reason it would just shut off. When my grass was high and it was working it did cut through it without much of a problem. If everything worked fine my only complaint would be that the bag was too small and I could not figure out how to leave the back open to let the grass come out of the back without the bag on.
customer_reviews.author: Mandee Myers

customer_reviews.title: very powerful and efficient. did the job in one ...
customer_reviews.text: very powerful and efficient. did the job in one two three. I was able to cut part of my lawn/grass that was over 20 inches tall. for some reason all stores have this item on sale for online purchase only, let me tell you it's worthy the arrival wait time.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Outperformed famous name brand mowers I used - this Sun Joy does the job at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. Funky and cheap looking, but this thing works great! I live in military housing and can use loaner equipment to mow the yard, which I did on several occasions. They've got some pretty well known name brands that I used. I absolutely didn't expect this Sun Joe to outperform. I was just looking for a more convenient alternative that wasn't too expensive. This thing cuts great and didn't slow down and bind up like the more expensive name brand equipment I had borrowed. Very happy with my purchase. This thing works great. Real basic. Nothing fancy. Does the job at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: My favorite lawnmower!
customer_reviews.text: I had this lawnmower before, had it for about 3 years, and loved it. Sadly, I hit a stump in my old yard that killed the poor thing. I recently moved, so figured it was time to get a new mower. I checked available selections, and for the price and the fact that I knew what a good job this would do, I got another Sun Joe! Be careful with the bag, it does tend to fill a bit quickly, especially with bigger jobs. Other than the bag size, I have no issues. Make sure you are using the right power cord to prevent burning the motor out.
customer_reviews.author: Jare

customer_reviews.title: Good Mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower works well. However, it requires a 12/3 (extension cord because it is 13 amps). The extension cord holder is different from that shown in the drawing. I was emailed a photo of the new holder in use. The 12/3 extension cord DOES NOT FIT IN THE HOLDER. THE HOLDER IS USELESS. I wrapped the extension cord around the mower's smaller power cord prior to connecting the two and plugging in to power. This holds well. However wrapping the mower's power cord around the extension cord DOES NOT WORK. They easily become unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent For Small Yards
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a condo with a MUCH, MUCH smaller yard than we had at our previous home--think about 10,000 square feet of yard versus about 400 square feet. I believe we paid about $69. Other reviewers said it looked like a toy. Yes, it is plastic, but it doesn't look cheap. It is relatively quiet, and I thought "No way did it cut the grass!" I was pleasantly surprised when my husband finished after 5 minutes and emptied out a full bag of grass! If you have a large yard, buy something that will take the punishment. This is a great little machine for the price if you have a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motor died the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: The mower died less than half way through mowing my very small and not overgrown lawn, on a nice sunny day, the very first time I tried to use it. Also, even if it worked, the three height settings are all very, very low. Hope you like your grass incredibly short. I think the grass on the part of the lawn that I did mow is probably going to die, it's so short. In addition, item is very flimsy and cheaply manufactured. Plastic seems like a toy. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Althea A. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Mower Ever
customer_reviews.text: I live on an acre of land out in the country. I'm a little person, and I need something that I can handle well, since I'm the one that takes care of the lawn. I was skeptical about this little mower, but let me tell you, I've had this for three years mowing several times a month in the summer months through thick tall grass, weeds, bramble, you name it! Little mow mow here, as I like to call her, handled it all like a champ!! I’ve left this mower outside in the hot Texas sun and through several storms over the years ( not on purpose) and this thing is still running.
customer_reviews.author: NikitaSmith01

customer_reviews.title: Great as long as you don't need it for more than a month!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mower a little over a month ago. I have a pretty small yard and had only used it 3 times when it just stopped working. Tried turning it on, no noise nothing. I had bought the four year insurance plan, but when I tried filing a claim, I was told that because I had bought it so recently, it was still covered by the manufacturer and I had to take it up with them, and they refused to help me further. Would never buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this product has enlisted the best seller. I used this machine to manage my small yard. After starting this machine, it sounds like working good, however, the cutter (or power) was too weak to cut even short grass. Also , the grass catcher was too small so I had to empty the catcher every single minute.... Moreover, I smelled that something was burned inside the machine after only 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jays Jongsoo Kim

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This mower came skewed so much that only three wheels can hit the ground at the same time. The holes in the plastic for the screws to attach the handle to the mower do not match the holes in the handle itself so had to be forced by making the plastic holes larger. The snap on grass catcher falls off frequently while mowing, causing all the caught grass to fall out on the lawn which defeats the purpose. (Happened three times today on small lawn. Each time it had clicked in and attached completely as advertised.) Very cheaply made!! It looks and acts like a toy,
customer_reviews.author: BAB

customer_reviews.title: Truly a bad lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I have nightmares from using this lawnmower. It doesn't handle well, the grass gets clogged, it can't handle even medium-thick grass well, my lawn was probably too big for this one, it's tiny and takes so long, and you're dragging a cord around. If you have any yard besides a tiny townhouse strip, or have any trees or bushes, and are considering electric versus gas, buy a gas mower. If you're stuck on electric, go with one that's bigger and/or has more power.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: Had my fair share of issues with gas mowers which lead me to try electric for the first time. Mower started up immediately and cut well through my already high growing grass. It is lightweight, but may take some planning for maneuvering as the cord gets in the way. Overall, easy to assemble but could not get the handle bars completely down into the mower where screws should hold it in place. But I managed to jam it down hard enough to get a snug enough fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tredrick

customer_reviews.title: Lower handle will not install correctly
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for one that I had for three years until the motor burned out the other day. I loved it, other than not being able to mow wet grass. Received this one and went to assemble, which is minimal, but the lower handle will not go into the base far enough to get the screws installed. But now, I cannot get the handle out either. Ha! I guess if I cannot pull it out, it should be secure enough. I’ll give it a shot and update my review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: What we needed
customer_reviews.text: We have a small amount of lawn so I did not revive my gas mower. Liked for the smaller mower for tiny lawn. I can verify that the mower is very capable of cutting the cord! D’Oh I knew I’d do it at some point. Mower cuts well with sufficient power, not too much noise and a properly sized catch basket. It’s a little awkward to maneuver since one hand needs to be managing the cord ( or should be ). I did not want to get a cordless just yet. Liking this mower so far.
customer_reviews.author: Eric E

customer_reviews.title: This is a tough little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough little machine. It is light weight, maneuverable and it cuts grass pretty good. I am a senior woman with a bad back and I can handle this mower with no problem. Update: I bought this mower twice. The engine of the first one burned out while mowing kudzu and the second started heavy vibrations after I'd had it for just 2 months and used it 3 times - this 2nd mower may have been a lemon because the first work actually worked well. The most impressive thing - I called the vendor and they're sending me a brand new replacement. I'm happy about that because I really really like the mower.
customer_reviews.author: Jayep

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality mower, does the job.....eventually
customer_reviews.text: It does the job....eventually, but it's extremely weak. Blade will stop spinning when cutting higher or thicker grass and I'd have to constantly remove the grass and wait about 3-4 seconds for it the blade to power back up again. The wheels are thin cheap plastic with 0 traction that barely rotates so pushing it really just glides the lawnmower over your lawn. It's extremely difficult to push at times due to that reason, especially once the bag starts to accumulate some grass.The bag must be use at all times or else the grass will fly all over the place, even with the rear flap down.
customer_reviews.author: VLLX

customer_reviews.title: Constantly shut off
customer_reviews.text: You get exactly what you paid for so I should have known. I had my lawn dug up reseeded because of bald spots different textured grass so I thought I would cut it myself when it got to the length I want. It wasn't that long or thick and this cheaply made lawn mower wouldn't even cut that. Once turned on about every 3 ft it shut off even had my neighbor try it same problem. The funniest was returning it to the garage the lawn mower never shut off. So if you want to cut your grass with this mower go backwards lol.. it's cheaply-made better off spending a little more for one that works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M.

customer_reviews.title: It's going back. Just horrid
customer_reviews.text: So it's smaller than I thought. That, I suppose, is on me. However, this is garbage. It doesn't mulch. It jams up if you don't use the bag which holds exactly 10 feet of clippings. For a normal yard, this means stopping every 3 minutes to empty it. It has no height adjustment and made the lawn look scalped. Here in Texas, cutting it that short is really unhealthy as it loses water to quickly. Perhaps it would work for a very tiny, condo yard.
customer_reviews.author: L. Appleman

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding mower for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is an excellent product, and it was inexpensive. The electric motor is quite powerful, the wheel height adjustment is excellent and easy to use. The grass catcher is phenomenal. It protects the user from flying debris, and it collects all of the grass clippings for a nice clean yard after mowing. I'm not find of mowing with a 50' extension cord; however, my yard is small, and it is a small price to pay for the convenience of the electric mower. It does a great job. The mower is also extremely light which is very helpful for me since I have an injured leg.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is almost a perfect lawnmower. Not only does it save the expense of gas (which is currently $2.59/gallon in our area and rising) and oil. It is super lightweight and easy to use - cuts the thick grass very easily. The only complaint is the bag in the back. We have a decent side yard and it is too big of a pain to have to keep emptying it. We would have given this 5 stars if it had a side vent (for the grass) instead for less of a hassle. Overall, very happy with this electric lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price = cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Used it about four times in a small yard. Handle snapped on one side but it was still operable, so I dealt with it. On the next now job, the whole thing stopped working after mowing about 30 sq yards. As I was troubleshooting I noticed the back wheel was almost broken off. I regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Y. M. Z. P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Mower
customer_reviews.text: This little mower does the trick. Don't think that this will be good for a large yard or for someone with very long grass though. I have a small yard and had to stop a few times to clear the grass from under the machine as it kept getting stuck. The grass was not wet by any means, but maybe it was damp near the ground, who knows. Great mower for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong a year later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last March (2019) to save money over paying someone $20 every 2-3 weeks to mow our tiny yard. I figured that even if it only lasted one summer, it still would pay for itself. We're almost through our second summer using it and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy319

customer_reviews.title: works great for my small front lawn
customer_reviews.text: No issues, works great for my small front lawn, the power chord takes some getting used to, since you have to drag the cord with you vs a gasoline mower. It handled tall grass and weeds well, and it is not too loud. The grass catch bag is a little on the small side (this is not a large mower), so expect to empty it a lot if you have a large lawn. Otheriwse I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: I'll go cordless with everything from now on!
customer_reviews.text: I should have known better. This is partially my fault. I tried to save money by buying the less expensive corded model. Even for my very small lawn, I ended up needing extension cords that cost as much as the mower, due to the distance needed (fifty feet isn't very helpful, even in a small space). With the extra cost, and tremendous nuisance involved in manipulating the cord, I'm kicking myself for not going with a cordless model from the outset. FOR ME, this was a waste of money and a write-off, since I ended up going out and buying a cordless model.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great electric mower
customer_reviews.text: Great mower for the price. Easy to assemble out of the box, easy to use. The right front wheel fell off, but it was an easy fix to remove the yellow wheel cover, put the wheel back on, and squeeze the metal clip holding the wheel on a little tighter and it was fine from then on. On the lowest setting, it only bogged down for about a second on one low spot of very dense bermuda grass but it quickly recovered and the RPMs went right back to where they were supposed to be. Very quiet. Grass catcher worked as it was supposed to, easy to detach/reattach.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: It is garbage! It is so lightweight and I thought oh how wonderful! Until it cut a 10 feet patch and died..... I ended up cutting the entire yard with my old manual mower. Now to return....after disassembling and putting all back in the box, I missed the UPS guy for pick up. Now to reschedule I have to pay, or I need to take to a drop off location which is far from me. Lesson learned. Do not but big tools online.
customer_reviews.author: lylah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small mower, even better customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SunJoe mower, the first having lasted 10 years and was running fine until a flood ruined it. The new one had some shipping damage that bent the lower handle and made the tubing out of round so it would not mount properly. One call to Trish at SunJoe and the replacement part was shipped and arrived two days later. Great mower, great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: macts473

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the cut is really good.
customer_reviews.text: It is lite weight, I love how easy it is to start. Lawn looks very even and pretty when I'm done. I had to unscrew the tightening knobs on the push handle from an outside to inside mount because the knobs were constantly getting caught in my chain-link fence. Now it mows smoothly along the fence. If your trying to decide between battery or electric mower, having to deal with the cord all the time is a bit of an issue but I did work out a routine to make it work for me. I do like my Sun Joe and am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are a problem
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this mower for almost two years, and for a small mower for my small yard, it does the job. Negatives.... The grass collection bin falls off easily so you need to be careful not to bump it. The wheels are connected with a tiny little clip that is nearly impossible to get on should you loose or need to replace a wheel. This happened to me and Sun Joe very quickly sent me a replacement wheel kit, however, there were no instructions in the owner manual nor were any sent with the new wheels. When this mower dies, I will not by another Sun Joe because of the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So we bought this mower for our new house. We have a small front yard and back yard. It does look like an adult playschool mower, but it is worth it. It is inexpensive and gets the job done. The grass bag is small and my husband has to dump it more frequently than our last mower, but it cuts beautifully. We had to raise it to the highest setting as the middle setting cut lower than we expected. Def. don't recommend for a large lawn. Also took some getting used to the cord (remember to buy a long extension cord) since our last mower was gas powered.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gaulden

customer_reviews.title: A fine electric mower!
customer_reviews.text: Sun Joe 14-inch 12 Amp Electric lawnmower arrived promptly. Assembly is simple, with no missing parts or any issues. However 30 minutes into using the lawnmower it just died. It was not Sunjoe's issue. The outdoor outlet went bad. Since that was fixed the mower works great. I wouldn't use this on any property over a half an acre due to needing a power cord. Their customer service is great, they do like to go a little Jersey when you call. Get the power cord they offer if you are not sure about which to use though.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe reigns supreme
customer_reviews.text: I recently received Sun Joe as a gift. I admit that initially I did not expect much. It's pretty small and isn't very heavy. But Sun Joe has exceeded my expectations. It's supported me through thick and thin. One time, I literally let me grass grow for 3 months whilst traveling abroad and also due to laziness after I returned home. Sun Joe went out there and dominated 8-9" blades of grass with seemingly little effort. I love my Sun Joe.
customer_reviews.author: J Tea

customer_reviews.title: A company that stands by their product.
customer_reviews.text: I got this mower in the fall of 2017 and it did a wonderful job on my city yard. This spring we got it out and it started up fine for a couple of minutes and died. Checked all the connections and the extension cord but it was still dead. I called the company, and they sent me a replacement that same week with a return label to send my dead one back to them. No fuss, no muss. The people at the Snow joe / Sun joe company couldn't be nicer. On their website the have other products that I think I might get as they back their products so well.
customer_reviews.author: Two fat ladies

customer_reviews.title: Good for a small yard.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small front yard and this lawnmower is awesome. It cuts good, is super lightweight and is reliable. I used it on the lowest setting and it cuts real clean. Not too short probably about an 1”. The only issues I have with it is if the yard is a a little wet or too long it gets clogged up and will shut off. The grass clippings bag is also really small so expect to empty it a lot. Otherwise l, I would recommend because it’s reliable, cheap and gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Patrick LeBeau

customer_reviews.title: Decent mower
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of electric mowers, but this one for the price is a decent mower. Our old electric mower pretty much fell apart late in the summer/early spring. Only needed a mower for a couple more weeks, so we ordered one of the cheapest ones we could find. As I already stated, for the money not a bad purchase at all. We have a small front and back yard, living in a row home.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Bywaters

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all, but the customers care really don't wanna help you
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and used it max. 10 times on my 250 sgft lawn. Easy busssines. Unfortunately from day to day stopped working. I contact the customers care. After 2 days they contact me with questions what cord did I used :-))). I wrote them, that I tried 6 cords and one of them was heavy duty Dewalt, so it is not cord issue. From that time no-one contact me.... I was happy with this small and easy manueverable product, but guys their customers service is really unfriendly and quality of product is under expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: **Updated review**  Cheap crap.  Save your money and get a real mower.
customer_reviews.text: Decent power even in tall grass, but they cheaped out on design: the wheels are cheap plastic, and the clip that holds them on is made of plastic too, instead of metal; one has already broken. I had to jury-rig a substitute out of washers and an E-clip in order to keep the wheel on its axle. In addition a large crack has developed in the deck--also made of plastic. In short: works well, until the plastic parts start breaking. Update: year three, and two wheels have now come off. In addition the (plastic) shroud around the blade is breaking off bit by bit. BOTTOM LINE: piece of crap. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brice

customer_reviews.title: Weeds cannot be cut very short
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it is a electric lawn mower, and I hate to refill engine oil. This is good for women to use because it is small and light. However, weeds cannot be cut very short. The weeds still remains about 2-3 inches tall after using this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Wong

customer_reviews.title: Lot of bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed! Read the booklet get the right gauge extension cord. This lil guy is really doing the work of a gas powered mower. I use it for trimming around our huge house where the big tractor can't. I am small, under 5 ft tall and about 100 lbs. Mid 50s. I do not care to learn about gas engines and need something for trimming after Hubby mows the 5 acres. We keep livestock, and my cows and goats love the trimmings. We have used it a for a few weeks now and I am impressed. I also have a Sun Joe 2030 PSI pressure washer and I like the brand 100%.
customer_reviews.author: J Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Big power in small package!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for over a year, and it is a work horse! I've used it to mow a smaller "tamed" front lawn as well as a 6K sq ft jagged, rock and branch-filled back yard. Something in the back yard got stuck on the blade and made the blade cut into the green plastic by the wheels a little bit, but it still works perfectly! Some others have said the height adjustment slips, but I haven't had any problems with that at all. This little mower that you could mistake for a toy works like the big boys. I haven't used the grass collector bag, yet.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: ... about getting this mower because it was such a great price and looks a little like a toy mower
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about getting this mower because it was such a great price and looks a little like a toy mower, but it is amazing! I used it to mow my lawn for the first time this evening and it did a wonderful job. I paid more money to buy the 12 gauge 100ft extension cord (as suggested in the product info), but it was worth it. It is very lightweight, cuts the grass with very little effort and has a big bag for cuttings. I am very happy with my new mower!
customer_reviews.author: Tonia L. Wind

customer_reviews.title: Fab little mower!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower and very much prefer it to other gas and electric mowers I have used. It works best for grass that is <~8 inches --if you are trying to mow tall grass it will stall out. PSA: if the mower turns off try the reset switch directly under the ignition button! Thought I had blown the capacitor and replaced it before I gave in and read the manual :P
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: A great choice
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely for small lawns, but that being said I simply love this mower. So easy to use and relatively powerful. I had to use the bagger the last two times I mowed because the grass was very long. It did great, and the bag is very easy to empty and reattach. This unit is so light you can easily carry it. If you have a small lawn, I would highly recommended give this mower a try.
customer_reviews.author: foxy

customer_reviews.title: Better than gas powered and cheaper too
customer_reviews.text: It may look a bit like a toy, but this is a fantastic mower. It will cut through thick grass without slowing down that I know for a fact would kill the engine on a small gas-powered mower. Cord management is easy when you get used to it. I figured it out on the first use. The mower is light and easy to push and maneuver. I'm quite impressed with the Snow Joe, and happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: This thing as beast
customer_reviews.text: Second sun Joe product I bought and it is good as the first. Great small mower, bag is awesome. Work perfect on my small yard, but would easily handle more.. definitely recommend this and sun Joe company.. you won't be disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I had to return mine due to it not working. Not sure why it messed up but as I was cutting the grass the lawnmower would turn off every 6" or so. My grass was not tall, but it is thick. I did have it set at the highest cutting level which is a little less than 3". It was easy to assemble, seemed very sturdy, and is light weight so easy to maneuver. It didn't work for my lawn, but I think if your yard is a bit more sparse it could work very well
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Great well-priced mower.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product. It's doing its job well. On its first use, it mowed through tons of overgrown clover, without any issue. the clipping bag isn't huge, so, depending on the size of your job, you will probably have to stop to empty, but that is quick and easy. I've been using it regularly for the past couple months with no complaints. I feel the Price was excellent
customer_reviews.author: TEK

customer_reviews.title: Good little mower
customer_reviews.text: I needed an electric mower due to a shoulder injury and chose this one. I am very happy with it for my 20' x 12' lawn. It is very light weight and made of plastic, including the wheels. It does look like a child's toy, but I've been using it since summer 2018 and it does a great job. I also like that the handle folds down, making it very compact for storage. If you don't have a lot of mowing to do, this will do the job. Plus, you never have to worry about gas or oil, which is a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Holtman

customer_reviews.title: Works great, lightweight, ideal for small yards
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this mower for several months. It’s lightweight and easy to carry and move. I have a small yard so it is ideal. I would not recommend for larger yards. One slight negative is that as the grass catcher fills with clippings it’s weight overpowers the actual mower because it becomes lighter than the catcher. Empty often and it’s no problem. Overall great item for my small property.
customer_reviews.author: RLP

customer_reviews.title: I love the electric aspect. When we switch to 100% Renewables, this will be the only way to go. It's so cheap to operate.
customer_reviews.text: It's great. It's so cheap to operate, and basically no maintenance. Figure when you need to replace a gas mower, the oil, the gas, the pollution, etc., and then this model, or style . . . it's a no brainer. It's cheaper to purchase, lasts longer, no maintenance, and every time you mow your lawn, it's under 15 cents. It's also great in town. If you're out of town, I advise to get a higher gauge/amps, but it's so much worth it, I feel I had a mental deficiency running a gas powered mower.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Decent mower for small yards.
customer_reviews.text: This lawnmower is suitable for my needs. I have a very small yard, about .05 acres, and it works well for me. My biggest gripe is that you have to empty the bag very frequently when mowing or else the mower will get clogged and shut off. You will need to buy at least a 100 foot extension cord for this mower as it doesn't have a battery pack, but I knew that when I bought it. I would recommend buying the attachment that will eject the clippings onto the ground if you don't want to bother with the bag and don't mind having to rake afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mazzara

customer_reviews.title: great little machine; wonderful customer service online chat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower for a 10x10 spot in front of our building. There's some uneven terrain and old plants. Mower works great, catcher works great (although I fill it up fast, that's not a flaw in the design). We had a litttle problem with a wheel that came off under extreme circumstances, so I contacted Sun Joe with my model # and Serial # in hand and Amazon order open - first by phone (on a Tuesday 1pm central time) and after waiting 15 minutes on hold, I tried the online chat option. In just a few minutes Andres, the Live Support operator, had helped me with everything. The part is on the way. My favorite mower ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST MOWER EVER!
customer_reviews.text: 1. Easiest mower ever to assemble. I am 61 and it took me 10 minutes to put it together. 2. I downsized to a rental and when I arrived, there was 10" of grass in the back yard. This mower plowed through it and did not stall once. 3. It is extremely lightweight compared to a gas mower, plus there is virtually no maintenance (spark plugs, oil, etc.). Just wipe it down and go. 4. GET THE RIGHT EXTENSION CORD, otherwise you will risk ruining the mower or it won't have enough power. 5. For the price of the mower and the cord together, there is no way to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Wendywoman

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: I am an elderly lady and my gas mower was getting too heavy for me to push around. The Sun Joe electric mower is very light weight and I am able to easily mow my lawn now. The biggest problem is keeping the electric cord out from under my feet. It is a good little mower and I am glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: BRENDA B.

customer_reviews.title: Small but Mighty!
customer_reviews.text: '''''' The Mow Joe!! Quite impressed with how much it can handle considering its size & weight. The type of grass I have is like cutting carpet, and bulky gas mowers struggle. With the right height adjustment, this thing powered through no problem. I really like how compact it is. It fits in spots where most mowers won't, less edging required, and less storage. No gas, no oil, no spark plugs- easy peasy! And it came with a nice grass catcher. For the price, this thing could make it only one season and its still worth it- I'd buy a new one every year.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for 80 bucks on a deal. It's cheap but does the job. The handle is held on by two screws that instantly stripped when assembling. The handle is fine although I wish the connecting points weren't plastic. It definitely can be carried. The bag will fall off if you are on a steep incline which can be frustrating but hey for 80 bucks I cut my small lawn three times so far with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Happy purchase
customer_reviews.text: So I was sceptical about this mower but let me tell you this thing has cut up sticks I've failed to pick up and cuts grass up to 3-5 inches high without a problem. I purchased to replace gas mower that was making me sick due to fumes. The only con is you will need the correct attachment, the bag it came with was to small and would clog the mower making me empty it every few feet. The mulch thrower option is best in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love this mower!
customer_reviews.text: Received this mower today, I have a small fenced in yard, 200 ft. Works like a dream! The grass carving bag is awesome. It's light weight, easy to put together and I used with a 50ft. Ext. cord..I will update if it developed problems, but I think this is so well made it will last me a while. The price was less expensive that Home Depot and Lowe's..
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Great for hills
customer_reviews.text: I have a STEEP hill on my property, like near 90 degrees and I’m not kidding. And yet it still grows grass which gets too long and the town was yelling at me to mow it. There’s no way I’m putting a ride on mower on that cliff. So I bought this. It works fantastic. This wasn’t a great buy and I recommend it for anyone trying to mow an incline
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Don't use wrong gauge extension cord.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the price, ease of assembly and easy to use. HOWEVER, do not buy the WRONG extension cord. The Amazon says "buy both kawm no were and Coleman extension cord together", We assumed this extension cord was the right gauge, it was not. It will burn up the motor if you don't use the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Nanc

customer_reviews.title: Buy this mower instead of a gym membership!
customer_reviews.text: It cuts grass. Your upper body will get a decent work out. It has the tiniest grass catching bag on Earth. Seriously. I get the best aerobic exercise running back and forth to the trashcan to empty the mini bag. And now the grass catcher has a growing hole. Of course. Because I'm a lazy butt and let the bag get too full before I run my relay race to the trashcan. But it was a decent price and it does cut grass. It is just the grass catcher. Ugh. On the bright side, I do get a full body workout.
customer_reviews.author: Rell

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It's a breeze to use, and because it's electric, I dont have to mix gas and oil, or keep a can of gas around, or run to the gas station half way through the job...ever! It's quiet, but works like a champ. The grass catch is a bit small, but it's manageable, and comes with a side discharge. Great economy mower. Fantastic for a small yard (it's even OK for a bigger yard). Would happily buy another, in the future. The cost of the mower (and a 50' extension cord) was less that what I'd have paid for 3 mowing. I figure it'll save me around $750-800 this year alone.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimate Realities

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high hopes for this little thing, but it has proven me wrong more than once now! The cord is inconvenient BUT it makes up for it with everything else! It starts up on the first push of the button every time. It isn't super loud. It will cut right through the grass without stalling even a little, even when it's SUPER tall (I didn't mow for 2 weeks!) It is small, so it takes a few extra laps, but hey, you get your exercise! The bag doesn't hold much, but the mower is nice and light weight and folds up for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: mower is beyond expectation
customer_reviews.text: This mower is great.Came new in the box.Only the handle and catcher bag had to be attached before use.Easy instructions.only took about 20 minutes to put together.Went to hardware store and bought the correct extension cord for this mower.It is 12 volt and has a round plug on the mower so you will need to buy one if you don't already have one.This was delivered fast!!!Quite and mowes smooth.I use it to do trim work around the flower beds and between my out building and the house.Its alot easier to use than the weed eater.Great price and well worth the money.made to last.Easy to adjust wheel hight so I can cut close to the ground.Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: judy savage Lemaster

customer_reviews.title: Worth!!!
customer_reviews.text: Better for the earth! and super light and easy to pick up. Push button start! Easy to change blades! Powerfull! Don't buy a 9 amp or less! Get 13 or up... Cheap! Quiet! Arrived quikly! Assembled easy! Use if you have a small yard that's the only thing... If you have a town house or 1 acre or less this is perfect! More than an acre don't do it....
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: I really like the concept of this mower
customer_reviews.text: I really like the concept of this mower. I have asthma and had to give up yard work years ago because i couldn't handle the grass flying and the gas fumes. This mower solved both of those issues; the bag keeps the grass from flying and there are no fumes. However, i underestimated the size of my yard and should have gotten the larger size. I also would opt for a cordless option on my next purchase. If you have anything larger than a townhome sized yard i would recommend you get the larger size mower.
customer_reviews.author: KNimon

customer_reviews.title: Too cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about 2 months ago and although we didn't have high expectations, considering how cheap it was, we are highly disappointed in how long it lasted. Back wheels literally snapped off on the third use. We have a very small yard and it is very lightly used. The plastic itself is broken, its not fixable and the nuts are literally inside the wheels (somehow). Cant return it and really dont want to buy a new mower this late in the season. Would not at all recommend, plastic is just too cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: An electric mower manages to stall
customer_reviews.text: One big advantage of electric motors over gasoline motors is that they deliver awesome work at low RPM. Just ask any Tesla owner.I have had other electric mowers in the past, and they have delivered on this promise. This mower managers to stall. I suspect that the problem is that some designer decided to use a cheap shaded pole induction motor rather than the series wound or permanent magnet motors that responsible companies use in tools of all sorts. Furthermore when it does stall, it struggles to restart. The mower is usable, but just barely. -dk
customer_reviews.author: Richard and Rebecca King

customer_reviews.title: The greenworks one worked great so I was all for buying a new cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Greenwork that I had bought 4 years ago. The greenworks one worked great so I was all for buying a new cheap electric mower. This mower is very cheaply made, it has several problems. 1.) We mow our lawn every week and even doing it weekly several parts of the grass gets to high that the mower cant handle it, which the green works mower never had that problem. 2.) the handle is very cheaply made and wont stay locked upright. Where the 2 pieced connected they dont lock into place well enough. When I push to mow the grass it keeps bending back down.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Brogan

customer_reviews.title: Great mower for the price.....
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased to see that this mower far exceeds what I expected for the price. It was very easy to put into use and performs much better than I expected. The narrow width allows me to get into tight spots that a larger mower would not be able to reach. It has plenty of power and is not very loud. It is light enough to move easily from mowing site to site but yet heavy enough to perform well. I would not hesitate to purchase another if and when I need one.
customer_reviews.author: Ed - TWEP

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Its a little electric mower. I have a small yard and it does the job perfect. 4 minutes to assemble, easy to use. Kids can now mow grass without having to understand how to trouble shoot a gas engine. What is not in the description - You do not have to use the bagger function, the grass will eject behind the rear wheels underneath the bagger flap. The trigger has a built in circuit breaker which is a great idea because if it clogs or you run over a dog toy and jam the blade it wont trip the house breaker. Just unplug, clear the blade, plug back in, reset the mower breaker and keep mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Millsy

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Just mowed the lawn for the first time today. Everything went smoothly! This lawn mower is easy to maneuver, waaay quieter than my old gas mower, and all of the issues I thought I might have had with it are non-issues. I was worried, for example, that it wasn't going to be powerful enough. It is virtually the same as what I'm used to. I thought it was going to be small, but I bet I make 1 1/3 passes I would have made with my old mower. The bag is easy to use and I was actually surprised by how much it held. Overall, I'm impressed. And unless I've updated this review, I'm still impressed.
customer_reviews.author: johndabaum

customer_reviews.title: It's lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This lawnmower is wonderful! it's lightweight, easy to use, easy to empty the bag , easy to clean after use and the price was so low I almost thought it would be too cheap to work but low enough to give it a try. Sure glad I did, it's perfect for a senior woman like myself who still likes to garden and do my own yard. I'l never go back to the old heavy gas mower that is heavy and hard to start. This one starts first time, every time, I just hold the lever down and push the button.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Pieces don't even fit together
customer_reviews.text: Cannot complete step one of the assembly instructions: "Fit the lower handle into the two holes in the machine body." I've triple checked the instructions, and I'm trying to fit it together correctly. This piece of junk was made so cheaply that the pieces don't fit together. Now that it is partially assembled, I can't take it apart to fit it back in the box so I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: Compact, quiet, light, and picks up the leaves etc
customer_reviews.text: I love this little mower. It picks up and mulches grass, leaves, pine needles, small sticks. I used this all through the winter until it snowed to keep the leaves off and hopefully help the grass this spring. So far so good. The bag folks and is easy to empty. Quick to fold and put in the shed.
customer_reviews.author: alex b

product_meta.title: Sun Joe MJ401E 14-Inch 12 Amp Electric Lawn Mower with Grass Bag, Green
product_meta.description:
Style:OriginalGreat in tight spaces! Responding to the need for an easy-to-use electric mower for smaller lawns, Sun Joe developed the Mow Joe MJ401E. Compact & lightweight (only 29 lbs. ), The Mow Joe MJ401E is a lean, mean & Green mowing machine that gets your yd. chore done without polluting the atmosphere with toxic carbon emissions. Mow Joe starts instantly with the simple push of a button & its rugged all-terrain wheels make it easy to maneuver in tight spaces. Equipped with a durable steel blade, mow Joe cuts a 14" Wide swath with each pass. Tailor the grass cutting height with its 3-position manual height control, which adjusts from 1 18" To 2 52". Its 10 6 gallon hard-top rear bag conveniently collects grass clippings & Detaches easily for quick disposal. A collapsible handle allows for easy & compact storage when not in use. Etl-approved; full 2-year.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Responding to the need for an easy-to-use machine that takes care of the smaller yards, Sun Joe developed the Mow Joe MJ401E, a smaller electric lawn mower that delivers the power of a gas machine with the convenience of an electric unit. Its durable steel blade cuts 14 wide with precision on each pass. In addition to its hard-working mowing capacity, the Mow Joe features a three position manual height adjustment. The Mow Joe is equipped with a hard top rear bag, which detaches easily for convenient disposal. No gas, oil, or tune-ups are necessary. The unit is ETL-approved and carries a full two year warranty.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL: 13-amp motor cuts a 14-inch wide path
Adjustable deck: tailor cutting Height with 3-position Height control
STEEL BLADES: Durable 14-Inch steel blade cuts with precision

We’ve got you covered! : your new lawn mower is backed by the snow Joe + Sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant New, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. No questions asked. Contact snow Joe + Sun Joe customer Support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,767 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
